Exaggerate: The claim does not seem to exaggerate any information.
Understate: The claim does not seem to understate any information.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim does not seem to make any problematic assumptions.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide any alternative explanations.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the images show the aftermath of a plane crash in Havana, Cuba, in May 2018, when in reality, the images show unrelated plane crashes in Las Vegas and Kathmandu.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting unrelated images as evidence for the stated claim.
